label: Western Australian mineral fields and districts
description: The State of Western Australia is divided into various Mineral Fields that represent administrative land subdivisions under which mining is administered in the State according to Section 16 of the Mining Act 1978. Some mineral fields are further subdivided into Districts. Mineral field and district boundaries can be changed by proclamation under the Mining Act 1978 — the listing provided is current as of June 2023. Each mineral field or district is characterized by a two-digit prefix code used for map representations and tenement indexing. Most districts and some mineral fields are also characterized by an upper case letter code: these are historical identifiers currently not applied, but are relevant for legacy mining tenement information. Field and district proclamations date back as far as the late 1890s; individual entities may have undergone several alterations of boundaries and even been changed from district to field (NB the gazetted date provided usually refers to the first entity). In gold-endowed areas, mineral fields were originally classified as 'Goldfields', but this categorisation stopped with the ratification of the Mining Act 1978. In terms of management, tenements under each mineral field are administered under a designated Mining Registrar (here expressed as collections). Information for this vocabulary was sourced from the Tengraph (Web) Help (https://www.dmp.wa.gov.au/tgwhelp/mineral-fields-and-district-codes-637.aspx), the Department of Mines, Industry Regulation and Safety (https://dmp.wa.gov.au/History-and-locations-of-the-12531.aspx) and a dedicated Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mineral_fields_of_Western_Australia) webpages, as well as the consolidated printed version of the 1904 Act and individual Western Australian Government Gazettes.

concepts.label: Broad Arrow Mineral Field
concepts.definition: An administrative division of land in Western Australia that covers the Broad Arrow area in the central-southern part of the State. The Broad Arrow Mineral field covers an area of 2668 km2 and contains no districts. Gazetted on 17 November 1896, it is administered by the Kalgoorlie Mining Registrar.

concepts.label: Bulong District
concepts.definition: An administrative division of land in Western Australia, the Bulong District is situated within the East Coolgardie Mineral Field in the central-southern part of the State, and covers an area of 2564 km2. Gazetted on 20 March 1896, it is administered by the Kalgoorlie Mining Registrar.
altLabels: E Coolgardie M F  Bulong Dist 25

concepts.label: Southwest Mineral Field

The Southwest Mineral Field covers an area of 229,561 km2 and contains no districts. Gazetted on 10 November 1961 (a district before this date), it is administered by the Perth Mining Registrar.

concepts.label: Warburton Mineral Field
concepts.definition: An administrative division of land in Western Australia that covers the Warburton area in the central and southeastern part of the State. It covers an area of 521,233 km2 and contains no districts. Gazetted on 15 May 1981, it was formed by the amalgamation of the Eucla, Nabberu and Warburton Districts. It is administered by the Perth Mining Registrar.

concepts.label: Mount Margaret Mineral field
concepts.definition: An administrative division of land in Western Australia that covers the Mt Margaret area in the central part of the State. concepts.label: Murchison Mineral Field

The Murchison Mineral Field covers an area of 65,977 km2 and contains four districts. Gazetted on 24 September 1891, it is administered by the Mt Magnet Mining Registrar.

concepts.label: North Coolgardie Mineral Field
concepts.definition: An administrative division of land in Western Australia that covers the area north of the Coolgardie town in the central-southern part of the State. The North Coolgardie Mineral Field covers an area of 35,242 km2 and contains four districts. Gazetted on 28 June 1895, it is administered by the Kalgoorlie and Leonora Mining Registrars.

concepts.label: North East Coolgardie Mineral Field
concepts.definition: An administrative division of land in Western Australia that covers the North East Coolgardie area in the central-southern part of the State. concepts.label: Pilbara Mineral field
concepts.definition: An administrative division of land in Western Australia that covers the Pilbara area in the central-northern part of the State. The Pilbara Mineral Field covers an area of 387,214 km2 and contains two districts. Gazetted on 1 October 1888, it is administered by the  Marble Bar Mining Registrar (currently based in Perth).
